page.syntax: Last_Button as C = form.dialog(C layoutname [,C windowname [,C filter [,C order [,C queryFlags [,C position_x [,C position_y [,L ShowNewRecord [,* arguments ]]]]]]]])

argument.name: layoutname
argument.description: The name of the form to open.

argument.name: filter
argument.description: Optional. Default = ".T." (All records). A character filter expression that evaluates to a logical value and selects the records to show in the dialog. This filter is in addition to any filter specified in the form's Properties dialog box.

argument.name: order
argument.description: Optional. Default = record order. A character order expression that sorts selected records.

argument.name: position_x
argument.description: Optional. Horizontal position of dialog. Overrides any position settings defined in the form's Properties dialog box. Options are:

argument.name: position_y
argument.description: Optional. Vertical position of dialog. Overrides any position settings defined in the form's Properties dialog box. Options are:

argument.name: ShowNewRecord
argument.description: Optional. If ShowNewRecord is .T., and if the user specifies a Filter and no records satisfy the filter condition, then Alpha Anywhere will open the form ready to accept a new record. However, if ShowNewRecord is .F. then Alpha Anywhere does not open the dialog box, and the function returns "NoRecordsFound".

page.description: Load and show a Form as a dialog.
page.discussion: The .DIALOG() method opens Form_Name as a dialog box. When the user closes the dialog, the object name of the last button pressed is stored in Last_Button. See Opening a Dialog Box for more information. Limitations: Desktop applications only.
